stories.text:
Inspired by [this](https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=30822339) Ask HN last month, what are your favorite books on 3D game design in Unreal Engine 5 or 4?

I'm especially interested in deep dives on UE's rendering pipeline, shaders and materials, and blueprint / C++ best design practices.

Most of the top search hits are from outfits like Packt Publishing and seem generally to be of poor quality, so I supplicate myself to the HN hive mind.
stories.title: Ask HN: What are your favorite books on Unreal Engine?
What the Terra crash means for the future of crypto

stories.text:
Software like Sandstorm or Cloudron try to tackle the self-hosting problem. However, they require technical expertise to setup the software before non-technical users can use the software - that means few hosting providers provide Sandstorm or Cloudron as options.

Options like Docker or typing lots of command-line commands are not easy or simple for non-technical users.

Has anyone successfully got non-technical users or customers to install/self-host a web/SaaS app on a web server by themselves?

(Example: provide a custom OS image with a pre-configured web app - a user installs this on a VPS. Too complicated?)
stories.title: Ask HN: Is there an easy way non-tech users can self-host apps on a server?
Show HN: Open-source Firebase Alternative? It's here
